document_data.name: Kwalu
document_data.mainbody: ''Negus'' (Prince) '''Kwalu''' was the son of King [[Osaw I]] and a member of the ''[[bara]]e'', the seven "super-paladins" sworn to protect the holy city of [[Mezro]] in [[Chult]] before its destruction during the [[Spellplague]].
document_data.Description:
Kwalu was a handsome man. He had square features and deep eyes. He often dressed in a [[tobe]] of purple that had green triangles around his heart.

In the 1360s DR, Kwalu was over 100 years old, yet, like all ''barae'', he was immortal.
document_data.Personality: Kwalu had a very intense personality and took very seriously his role of protector of Mezro. He admired true bravery.
document_data.Abilities:
Like all ''barae'', Kwalu had been granted special powers from [[Ubtao]], which included the following:
* He could utter magical [[command]]s that would compel the hearer to obedience.
* He [[regenerate]]d health rapidly.
* He could [[detect evil]] at will.
* He had improved reflexes and physical and mental resistances.

If within the [[Temple of Ubtao]], he could also cast the following spells:
* ''[[Cure critical wounds]]''
* ''[[Forbiddance]]''
* ''[[Remove blindness or deafness]]''
* ''[[Remove disease]]''
* ''[[Restoration]]''
* ''[[True seeing]]''

In addition, Kwalu possessed the terrifying power to control vast swarms of locusts. Provided he had a single locust to begin with, he could summon a cloud of the insects more than 200 yards (180 meters) in width that would consume anything in their path.
document_data.Possessions: Kwalu never went anywhere without being armed. His weapon of choice was usually his ''[[kerrie]]'', or war club. It was pitted from having cracked so many [[Batiri]] skulls.
document_data.Relationships: The youngest of the ''barae'', the young girl named [[Fipya]], looked up to Kwalu as if he were her older brother.
